text: welcome to daily video vocabulary a dose
of daily new English phrases and words
brought to you by let's talk podcast
calm
hello English learners welcome to daily
video vocabulary episode 82 in today's
episode I have a new word for you
weary let's find out what it means and
how you can use it in your daily
conversation weary sometimes you are
very cautious about something as you
feel it can lead to a problem or to
something dangerous the word weary
basically means to be cautious or
careful of something if you are aware of
something or someone you are actually
cautious or alert because you do not
know much about them and you believe
they may be dangerous or cause problems
in other words you are very careful and
guarded and you are unwilling to trust
someone so when you give someone a wary
glance your face conveys the suspicion
and caution that you feel about them for
example you are wary of rocks while
walking barefoot in the water or you may
be wary of driving alone at night on an
empty road as you feel it's not safe as
the word wary describes being cautious
or careful about something it is an
adjective okay now that you know what
wary means let's take a look at some
example sentences to see how you can use
it in your daily conversation example
one being her first interview the new
actress was weary of talking to the
press media as she didn't want to
disclose about her personal life
example two due to the recent kidnapping
in the neighborhood mother told Ben to
be wary of strangers on his way back
from the high school example three
during the grand sale the store owner
kept a wary eye on all the customers
example four after the unexpected fall
in the share markets investors are
increasingly wary about investing their
money into the stock market example five
Lisa was wary of the stray dog at first
but he seemed friendly so she walked
over to pet him example 6 at the railway
station there is a warning board put up
that reads be wary of pickpockets
example 7 Maria told her friend
be wary of emails claiming that you have
won a lottery as they are off malicious
and contain viruses example 8 being new
in the city Sheila was wary of
everything around her and didn't
socialize with anyone example 9 the
teacher wearily watched the student who
was trying to cheat during his exams
example 10 all his colleagues are weary
of speaking with William due to his
arrogant attitude and temper that's the
end of today's episode I am sure you
must be worried about something what is
it and why kindly share your experiences
in the comment box below this video
thank you for watching us do watch all
the episodes of daily video vocabulary
to better your English language skills
do subscribe to our Channel and stay
updated with all the latest lessons I
will see you again tomorrow with a new
word or a phrase till then bye and take
care
